tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review: I have been going to Dr. Varun for the last 5yrs, every time I have been to him I always found a solution & never had to go back to him with a similar problem except for my plantarfascia treatment, though my pain has come down to a very large extent I need to reduce my body weight to get rid of it completely which am working on. I have also recommended my friend who is an ayurvedic Dr herself who was ailing from legament issue for years. She had difficulty walking & use to cry today after Dr. Varun operated on her she goes for jogging & is very happy. I personally would recommend Dr. Varun to all my friends very strongly. I wish him many more years of service.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review: I am  glad  and happy that I have meet dr Varun GBS because I been suffering  from tennis elbow pain for many years I gone to through many treatment with many doctors but not got cured but finally I meet thise doctor and cured and perfectly fn and had last  one year  back i meet with an accident and I had to get operated and same doctor I meet and finally I got cured, the doctor is so friendly and so concerned with patients health allot , i am so thank full to the doctor.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
Doctor is very kind & his treatment is best i must say from many days we were looking for her treatment showed to many doctors but didnt receive dt good treatment  frm any doctor  she was suffering from but by his medicines realy worked on her 
 all thanks to him 
He is very good at his profession.

tags: Treatment satisfaction,
review: It was insisted on conducting the tests at a particular diagnostic centre in malleshwaram saying the particualr tests were only available there. The lab was very unprofessional and wouldn't disclose the costs beforehand. Though they assured that they charge CGHS prices they charged me a hefty amount. Also I was prescribed painkillers which I was required to purchase only from the clinic and not from outside. The joint pain I was suffering from returned immediately after I stopped the painkillers.
reply_text:
Hi.. this to just clarify ur dissatisfaction at my clinic.
1.Let me be very clear .. we donot recommend you to go to any particular centre for blood investigations.. if asked only we recommend. Only if I prescribe a MRI then I generally refer u to a particular centre where the radiologist is good so that I can discuss certain issues if they exists OR I leave it to my patient to decide where they want to go.

2.The prices in any private Lab can never match CGHS.. since it's not govt aided ,my staff or myself would have never utter the word CGHS since we are not a part of it.

3.We keep certain basic medicines only for the convenience of the patient .As per rules only medicines can be dispensed to a patient.There is never a compulsion that u need to take it from the clinic.. since there are so many ways u can buy medications online offline.. so on Iam surprised U have bought it and complained. 

4.If u are reluctant to get the investigations how can i diagnose ur disease ..and there is no follow up.. pain automatically will recur since what I would have started is only for symptomatic relief.

I want to reemphasise that No patient coming to my clinic will be compelled to do anything against their decision. since it's the patients right to question get their doubts cleared and get their tests done wherever they want.
It is Patients rights.. and we doctors respect it.

tags: None
review:
Dr Varun is so friendly and patiently explains the problem without making a big deal out of it. He tries out basic treatment first, and encourages to bring out certain lifestyle changes, teaches exercises which will help soothe pain and solve the condition to a huge extent without jumping right into any major treatments.  
Dr Varun is certainly good at what he does, 10/10 recommend him!
reply_text: Thanks u so much for the feedback.. it means a lot to me.. hope ur doing great..

tags: Doctor friendliness,
review: Varun sir is best.im very happy sir. recomend please contact sir consult your problem and solve this problem

Doctor was very good in treating the pain. He is very polite and understands the problem and gives the proper medicine. Clinic. Staff and setup is also excellent.
Would definitely recommend him for your joint pains

tags: Value for money,
review: Charging 300 for strapping a tape on fingers ******* **** ************ ** **** * ***** ******* ** * ******** **** ***** ****** **** *** I got the Xray checked with another doctor ** ***** ****** ** ***** *** *** ******** ******** ** *** ***** *******Such unprecedented and unprofessional behaviour **** * ***** ** ****** *** *** ****** ******** can’t be accepted. My only restriction to not post it on social media is time.
reply_text:
Hi.. let me address to ur issues one by one.
1.When it comes to a procedure we have some reasons behind it, we can do buddy strapping with roller bandage which will cost rs 50 ,micropore costing rs 100 and adhesive plaster which I use that is expensive so rs300.

2.When u have an injury to ur toes or fingers, its 
   not just your bone which gets involved remember there are a lot of complex ligaments and tendons responsible for your fine movements.. as far as I remember there was swelling and pain hence suggested a xray,otherwise u would have not consulted me if it had not bothered you.

3.Iam sorry to tell u this .. we cannot say a fracture is there if it is not there.. it has to be seen.. for ur kind information Hairline fractures are not visible and we donot bother much about these fractures.
The reason for buddy strapping is not because there is a fracture or not, but there is a soft tissue damage and it will take 3wks for it to heal,immobilization will help heal it.

Sir u can take any number of opinions its ur right.. but I do my best so that we should never miss a diagnosis and regret if u develop a deformity later on weight bearing. 
Let me tell u this that it is a profession of ethics and it will remain so.. and patients like you will either find faults if in case an xray was not taken and the diagnosis missed. That's why doctors tend to over diagnose rather than underdiagnose due to such over/under educated patients like u who know how to put down the profession and pass bad remarks about a doctor who has made a hard way to reach this position.  We r not gods we treat he heals.
